headline: Passing the CFA Exam Is Tough. AI Just Did It in Minutes.
summary: The three-part Chartered Financial Analyst exam, particularly the Level III with its essays, is viewed as one of finance’s hardest. The fact that leading AI models sailed through reflects how quickly the field is advancing.

content.title: Passing the CFA Exam Is Tough. AI Just Did It in Minutes.
content.summary: The three-part Chartered Financial Analyst exam, particularly the Level III with its essays, is viewed as one of finance’s hardest. The fact that leading AI models sailed through reflects how quickly the field is advancing.

headline: Podcast: U.S. Stocks Break Three-Day Losing Streak

headline: Paccar, Boeing, Electronic Arts: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including PACCAR shares (PCAR) gain as President Trump eyes levying tariffs on imported heavy trucks, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) slowly easing restrictions on Boeing (BA) 737 Max production, and reports of video game studio Electronic Arts (EA) nearing a deal to bring the company private. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Paccar, Boeing, Electronic Arts: Trending Tickers
content.description:
Market Domination host Josh Lipton tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including PACCAR shares (PCAR) gain as President Trump eyes levying tariffs on imported heavy trucks, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) slowly easing restrictions on Boeing (BA) 737 Max production, and reports of video game studio Electronic Arts (EA) nearing a deal to bring the company private.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Electronic Arts Stock Jumps on Report of Leveraged Buyout Talks
summary: Shares in videogame maker Electronic Arts rose 15% after The Wall Street Journal reported that the company is nearing a deal to go private. A group of investors including private-equity firm Silver Lake and Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund could unveil a deal for the publisher best known for its sports games as soon as next week.

content.title: Electronic Arts Stock Jumps on Report of Leveraged Buyout Talks
content.summary: Shares in videogame maker Electronic Arts rose 15% after The Wall Street Journal reported that the company is nearing a deal to go private. A group of investors including private-equity firm Silver Lake and Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund could unveil a deal for the publisher best known for its sports games as soon as next week.

headline: The Club Is Yours! Play Your Way in EA SPORTS FC™ 26, Now Available Worldwide
summary: REDWOOD CITY, Calif., September 26, 2025--Today, Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ: EA) invites players from around the globe to celebrate the world’s game across platforms with the launch of EA SPORTS FC™ 26, available now for PlayStation®5, PlayStation®4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, Amazon Luna, Nintendo Switch™ and Nintendo Switch 2™, as well as through EA Play.
